cards.title: Jetpacks and vintage Vegas / Best of Arles photography festival

item.title: Jetpacks and vintage Vegas: the best of Arles photography festival
item.trailText: With tax havens around the world scrutinised, the leaning Tower of Pizza and long-lost colour film of Fellini’s 8 ½, this year’s Arles has got the lot
item.standFirst:
With tax havens around the world scrutinised, the leaning Tower of Pizza and long-lost colour film of Fellini’s 8 ½, this year’s Arles has got the lot

  • Recontres d’Arles runs from 6 July to 20 September 2015

displayImages.caption:
Anouk Aimée, from the series Fellini, 8 ½ Colour, by Paul Ronald
Ronald took one colour roll of film on the set of Fellini’s 1963 masterpiece – then it was forgotten, left in a box for decades. Now, the classic film can be seen in colour for the first time ever Photograph: Courtesy Archivio Storico del Cinema, AFE
displayImages.credit: Courtesy Archivio Storico del Cinema, AFE

displayImages.caption:
From The Heavens, Annual Report, Paolo Woods and Gabriele Galimberti’s expose of tax havens around the world
An employee of ‘Jetpack Cayman’ demonstrates the new watersport now available on the islands. Mike Thalasinos, the owner of the company, quips: ‘The Jetpack is zero gravity, the Caymans are zero taxes – we are in the right place!’

From The Heavens, Annual Report by Paolo Woods and Gabriele Galimberti
Hedge strimming in Jersey. In Jersey, individuals who earn at least one million dollars a year are actively encouraged to relocate to the island and are given automatic residential status, so they can benefit from the island’s low tax regime
